Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Pneumococcus \Pneu`mo*coc"cus\, n. [See {Pneumo-}, and {Coccus}.] (Biol.) A form of micrococcus found in the sputum (and elsewhere) of persons suffering with pneumonia, and thought to be the cause of this disease. [1913 Webster]
pneumococcus n : bacterium causing pneumonia in mice and humans [syn: {Diplococcus pneumoniae}] [also: {pneumococci} (pl)]
